page.title: 03Nant Paith - Capel Seion
page.content: The water from Penuwch Fawr fields drawn into the Paith forming its source. The stream has been helped by entrenchment, making it grow in confidence to eventually emerge through a boggy copse of willow & alder, where the cuckoo sings in spring, to the Llanfihangel-Pantycrug road. It runs under the road & falls fiercely into a pool the otherside & continues through the open well kept fields of Nantybenlog. The Paith increases in volume, although not in size, due to modern field drainage techniques employed by the farmers. The variegated small pebbles of different shapes together with many white stones on the banks & in the stream show the mark if water erosion through the ages. From here the stream adopts a more meandering nature & flows towards Nantyrhudd.
